cmCourseInfo.description: Research in theoretical astrophysics encompasses cosmology, galaxy formation and black holes. This course introduces students to modern computational techniques using large scale parallel numerical simulations, carried out at CITA and SciNet. This is an intensive two-week course taught in May.
cmCourseInfo.title: Computational Astrophysics
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: MAT135Y1/MAT137Y1/MAT157Y1; (PHY131H1, PHY132H1)/(PHY151H1, PHY152H1) or their equivalent.
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: Physical science, mathematics and computation, or engineering

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Credit course for supervised participation in faculty research project. Details at https://www.artsci.utoronto.ca/current/academics/research-opportunities/research-opportunities-program. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Research Opportunity Program
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: MAT135Y1/MAT137Y1/MAT157Y1; (PHY131H1, PHY132H1)/(PHY151H1, PHY152H1) or their equivalent
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: Physical science, mathematics and computation, or engineering

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes
